meaningMnemonic: A "suffering hand" is a little misleading. Think more in terms of the words 苦い (bitter) and 手 (person... remember how that happens sometimes?). Now think of this word like you're bitter about having to work with someone. Why? Because they are extremely <vocabulary>hard to deal with</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The reading is that of 苦い (にがい) plus regular old 手 (て). Remember, this is your bitter person, the person who's "hard to deal with." So, it uses the strange にがい reading.
